questions.question: What does HTML stand for?
questions.explanation: HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language. It is the standard markup language for creating web pages and web applications.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to change the text color?
questions.explanation: The 'color' property is used to set the color of text in CSS. For example: color: blue;

questions.question: What does the acronym SPA stand for in web development?
questions.explanation: SPA stands for Single Page Application. It's a web app that dynamically updates as the user interacts with it.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to define an unordered list?
questions.explanation: <ul> is used for unordered lists.

questions.question: What is the purpose of media queries in CSS?
options: To apply styles based on device characteristics
questions.explanation: Media queries apply CSS rules based on screen size, resolution, and orientation.

questions.question: Which property is used to change font size in CSS?
questions.explanation: font-size is used to change the size of the font.

questions.question: What does the <a> tag define in HTML?
questions.explanation: <a> tag defines a hyperlink in HTML.

questions.question: How do you insert a comment in a CSS file?
questions.explanation: CSS comments are written like /* comment */.

questions.question: Which HTML element is used to display a picture?
questions.explanation: is used to embed images in an HTML page.

questions.question: What is the default position value in CSS?
questions.explanation: The default CSS position is static.
